linkedWith

Class Link

  • java.lang.Object
    • linkedWith.Link

  • public class Link
extends java.lang.Object
    Link class to associate two users with each other as well as record the dates of any link creation/deletion
    Author:
    Adam Gleichsner (amg188@case.edu)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Link()
      Class constructor Creates an empty, invalid link

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean establish(java.util.Date date)
      If the link is currently inactive and the date passed is either after or equal to the most recent date in links, then we establish the link and record the date
      java.util.Date firstEvent()
      Grabs the first event in links as long as the link is valid and has been established before.
      java.util.Set<User> getUsers()
      Returns users if link is valid, otherwise throws an UninitializedObjectException
      boolean isActive(java.util.Date date)
      Finds status of the link at the given date.
      boolean isValid()
      Return whether or not the link is valid (i.e.
      java.util.Date nextEvent(java.util.Date date)
      Grab the event that occurs after the param date.
      boolean setUsers(java.util.Set<User> users)
      Takes a set of two users with non-matching ids and creates a link.
      boolean tearDown(java.util.Date date)
      If the link is active and the date passed is after or equal to the most recent date, then we go ahead and tear down the link and record the new date
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a human-friendly string showing the two users in the link and every event of establishing or tearing down.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Link

        public Link()
        Class constructor Creates an empty, invalid link

    • Method Detail

      • setUsers

        public boolean setUsers(java.util.Set<User> users)
        Takes a set of two users with non-matching ids and creates a link. If link is already valid (i.e.) or if the set of users contains anything but two unique users, no action is taken.
        Parameters:
        users - - Set of two unique users
        Returns:
        boolean - true if actions occurred, false if otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Return whether or not the link is valid (i.e. has users)
        Returns:
        boolean - true if valid

      • getUsers

        public java.util.Set<User> getUsers()
                             throws UninitializedObjectException
        Returns users if link is valid, otherwise throws an UninitializedObjectException
        Returns:
        Set - Set containing the two unique users in the link
        Throws:
        UninitializedObjectException

      • establish

        public boolean establish(java.util.Date date)
                  throws UninitializedObjectException
        If the link is currently inactive and the date passed is either after or equal to the most recent date in links, then we establish the link and record the date
        Parameters:
        date - - Desired date to establish a new link
        Returns:
        Boolean - true if added, false otherwise
        Throws:
        UninitializedObjectException
        java.lang.NullPointerException

      • tearDown

        public boolean tearDown(java.util.Date date)
                 throws UninitializedObjectException
        If the link is active and the date passed is after or equal to the most recent date, then we go ahead and tear down the link and record the new date
        Parameters:
        date - - Desired date to tear down the link
        Returns:
        Boolean - true if torn down, false otherwise
        Throws:
        UninitializedObjectException
        java.lang.NullPointerException

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive(java.util.Date date)
                 throws UninitializedObjectException
        Finds status of the link at the given date. If the link is invalid, throw an exception. If it is, determine if the date is already present, and if not, find where it fits into the list
        Parameters:
        date - - Desired date to determine whether or not the link was active then
        Returns:
        Throws:
        UninitializedObjectException
        java.lang.NullPointerException

      • firstEvent

        public java.util.Date firstEvent()
                          throws UninitializedObjectException
        Grabs the first event in links as long as the link is valid and has been established before. If link is invalid, throw an exception.
        Returns:
        Date - Date that the link was first established, null if not established
        Throws:
        UninitializedObjectException

      • nextEvent

        public java.util.Date nextEvent(java.util.Date date)
                         throws UninitializedObjectException
        Grab the event that occurs after the param date. If there is no event, return null, and if the link is invalid, throw an exception
        Parameters:
        date - - date prior to return event
        Returns:
        Date - date of next event, null if no event
        Throws:
        UninitializedObjectException
        java.lang.NullPointerException

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a human-friendly string showing the two users in the link and every event of establishing or tearing down. If the link is invalid, special text is returned.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String - string form of link
